meanings.sent1: The underthrust of the earthquake caused the ground to shake.
meanings.sent2: The underthrust of the elevator lifted us to the top floor.
meanings.sent3: The underthrust of the toddler's hand against the tower of blocks made them tumble down.
meanings.sent4: The underthrust of the wind against the sail propelled the boat forward.
meanings.sent5: The underthrust of the car's engine made it zoom down the road.

meanings.definition: To push or thrust from below.
meanings.sent1: She tried to underthrust the heavy door open with all her might.
meanings.sent2: The worker had to underthrust the lever to activate the machine.
meanings.sent3: He underthrust the ball with such force that it flew over the fence.
meanings.sent4: The athlete underthrust the shot put with precision and strength.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to underthrust the knife through the tough meat.

meanings.definition: The act of pushing or thrusting from below.
meanings.sent1: The underthrust of the piston in the engine created power.
meanings.sent2: The underthrust of the dancer's foot on the stage was graceful.
meanings.sent3: The underthrust of the broom against the dirt swept it away effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: The underthrust of the hammer against the nail secured it in place.
meanings.sent5: The underthrust of the waves against the shore eroded the sand over time.
